snippet: Pornographic film executives say that condom use reduces sales. Opinions differ on whether the multibillion-dollar industry will try to leave Los Angeles.
abstract: New ordinance requiring actors in pornographic films made in Los Angeles to use condoms could drive the multibillion-dollar industry from its long-established home in the San Fernando Valley; sexual health advocates have hailed the requirement as a milestone in protecting the health of sex-film performers, but pornographic film executives contend that condom use cuts deeply into sales, and that they may have to relocated in order to maintain profits.
lead_paragraph: Pornographic film executives say that condom use reduces sales. Opinions differ on whether the multibillion-dollar industry will try to leave Los Angeles.

headline.seo: Condom Rule May Drive Sex Films From Los Angeles
headline.main: Law on Condoms Threatens Tie Between Sex Films and Their Home
